trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Popup"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Popup> event of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> class is raised before a ToolTip is displayed.
The handler for this event receives a parameter of type PopupEventArgs.
This parameter provides information about the ToolTip and enables you to modify the size of the ToolTip through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PopupEventArgs.ToolTipSize%2A> property.
Because <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Popup> derives from <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs>, the handler can also stop the ToolTip from being displayed.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PopupEventArgs"></xref> class.
The parameters to the PopupEventArgs constructor are used to initialize the corresponding, similarly named properties.
The `associatedControl` parameter can be `null` if the owning window is not of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window"></xref> that the ToolTip is bound to.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> that the ToolTip is being created for.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the associated ToolTip window has a balloon-style appearance; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to indicate that the ToolTip window has a standard rectangular appearance.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> of the ToolTip.
Gets the control for which the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> is being drawn.

Because you can associate the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> with multiple controls through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.SetToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method, you can use the AssociatedControl property to determine which control the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Draw> event is associated with.
This is helpful if you want to perform different ToolTip customization based on the associated control.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> that is associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref>, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the ToolTip is not associated with a control.
Gets the window to which this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> is bound.
When a window is owned by another window, the owned window is minimized and closed with the owner window.
Owned windows are also never displayed behind their owner form.
In this case, the ToolTip is owned by the native Win32 window, represented by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.AssociatedWindow%2A> property.
The window which owns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the ToolTip is displayed as a standard rectangular or a balloon window.
The type of window used for the ToolTip is specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.IsBalloon%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> class.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the ToolTip is displayed in a balloon window; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if a standard rectangular window is used.
Gets or sets the size of the ToolTip.
The ToolTipSize property enables the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Popup> event handler to change the size of the ToolTip window.
ToolTipSize is often used in conjunction with the members of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs> class to customize the appearance of ToolTips.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> window.
